document.masterDocTitle: The recent apple snails of Africa and Asia (Mollusca: Gastropoda: Ampullariidae: Afropomus, Forbesopomus, Lanistes, Pila, Saulea): a nomenclatural and type catalogue. The apple snails of the Americas: addenda and corrigenda

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The recent apple snails of Africa and Asia (Mollusca: Gastropoda: Ampullariidae: Afropomus, Forbesopomus, Lanistes, Pila, Saulea): a nomenclatural and type catalogue. The apple snails of the Americas: addenda and corrigenda

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Pachylabra angelica
Annandale, 1920 a
: 5
, 11, pl. 1 , figs. 9, 10 , pl. 2 , figs. 5, 6 .
Type material
— syntypes : NZSI M. 11649 / 2 ( 2 spms.).
Type locality
—“Bangkok”. Distribution — Thailand .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . The description appears to be based on numerous specimens but only those in NZSI M. 11649 / 2 were explicitly indicated by
Annandale ( 1920 a: 14 )
as “Type-specimens” (presumably the two shells illustrated in pl. 1 , figs. 9, 10 , and stated in the “Description of Plate I” to be “Type-specimens”), thereby excluding any others from the type series ( Code , Art. 72.4.6). Synonym of
pesmei Morlet
, teste
Brandt ( 1974 : 51 )
. Valid species of
Pila
, teste
Keawjam ( 1986
: 61, 1987 : 69, 1990 : 1 ), followed here.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ampullaria begini
Morlet, 1889
: 184
, pl. 8 , fig. 1 .
Type material
— syntype (
Cowie & Héros 2012 : 797
): MNHN 4499 .
Type locality
—“Le Mékong et dans tout le Cambodge ” [The Mekong and throughout Cambodia ].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . Reported from Cambodia and Thailand (G.B. Sowerby
III 1910
: 57 ;
Annandale 1920 a
: 23 ). Valid species, teste G.B. Sowerby III ( 1910 : 57 ), Kobelt ( 1912 b: 87 ) and
Annandale ( 1920 a: 5 )
, followed by
Cowie & Héros ( 2012 : 797 )
, although a synonym of
pesmei Morlet
, teste
Brandt ( 1974 : 51 )
, followed here.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ampullaria borneensis
Philippi, 1852 b
: 24
[ 1852 a: 31 , pl. 8 , fig. 3 ].
Type material
—possible syntype : MNHNCL 15948 ( 1 spm., old number 61.061 , a label also says
celebensis
).
Type locality
—“Borneo”.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . Variety or form of
conica Wood
, teste
Nevill ( 1885 : 5 )
, G.B. Sowerby III ( 1910 : 57 ) and
Prashad ( 1925 : 85 )
. Synonym of
scutata Mousson
, teste
Brandt ( 1974 : 52 )
,
Low et al . ( 2013
: 56 ) and Ng et al . ( 2014 : 34 ), followed here.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ampullaria bourguignati
Billotte, 1885
: 107
, 109, pl. 6 , fig. 3 .
Type material
—location unknown.
Type locality
—“Le lac Balla, près d’El-Kantara” [Al Ballah Lake, near Al Qantarah]; “Isthme de Suez” [Isthmus of Suez] [ Egypt ].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . Noted as from “Ballat-See, Egypten ” by
Paetel ( 1887 : 477 )
, referencing the listing of the species by
Mayer ( 1886
[as “ 1885 ”]: 78 ). Valid species in
Pachylabra
, teste Kobelt ( 1912 b: 54 ), although he thought it might just represent individual variation. Synonym of
ovata Olivier
, teste G.B. Sowerby III ( 1910 : 60 ) and Pain ( 1952 : 287 ), followed here.

Ampullaria Bridouxi
Bourguignat, 1888
: [ 15 ]– 16 , pl. 5 , fig. 22 [name and figure] [ 1890 : 72–74 ; description].
Type material
— MNHN 4453 [not found in MNHN since 1988 ; no type material found in MHNG or MRAC (cf.
Dance 1986
: 206 )].
Type locality
—“l’embouchure du Malagarazi” [the mouth of the Malagarazi River]; “Lac Tanganika” [ sic ; in publication title] [ Tanzania ].

Remarks . Additional localities given in the later description (
Bourguignat 1890 : 74
): “vers le déversoir du lac, le Loukouga, au-dessous des îles Chakabala”. Variety of
ovata Olivier
, teste
Alderson ( 1925 : 93 )
,
Pilsbry & Bequaert ( 1927 : 181 )
and Pain ( 1952 : 291 ) but a synonym of
ovata Olivier
, teste G.B. Sowerby III ( 1910 : 60 ) and
Pain ( 1961 : 10 )
, followed here.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ampullaria Brohardi
Granger, 1892
: 97
, text fig.
Type material
— holotype [by monotypy: “l’unique exemplaire que nous possédons”]: NHMUK 1899.12.9.1.
Type locality
—“Pnom-Penh ( Cambodge )” [ Cambodia ].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks . Listed among “Varieties and aberrations” of
polita Deshayes
by
Alderson ( 1925 : 82 )
, despite
Granger ( 1892 : 97 )
explicitly stating that he thought it not to be “monstruosité”. Synonym of
virescens Deshayes
, teste G.B. Sowerby III ( 1916 : 69 ) and
Brandt ( 1974 : 49 )
, both as “
polita
”, followed here.
